data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is facing forward. All directions direct you to keep your "forward" motion running. Take 9 steps left and take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right and take 10 steps backward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The fourth instruction is a direct way of getting into your starting position. The fifth instruction is a redirect route. So, the answer is No.

You only need 4 steps to walk one step back. When you need to return to the starting point, you need to return back. If you turn around, you need to take 5 steps back. When you take 4 steps, you turn around. Turning back around, you need to take 5 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.

All steps return the person to the beginning point. If you followed the instructions correctly, you can return to the starting point but you cannot make a turn. So, the answer is No.
